moves.1. b4: The game starts with the Sokolsky opening.
moves.1... d5 2. Bb2 f6 3. d4 e6: The pawns and a White Bishop move out.
moves.4. Nc3 c6: More pieces opening. Notice Black has only used pawns so far.
moves.5... dxe4: Black takes the chance and takes the pawn.
moves.6... f5: Black tries to take whites knight.
moves.7... h5: Moving a side-rank pawn out. Black has STILL only used pawns!
moves.9... b5: Taking out the B pawn to take the bishop.
moves.10. Bb3 a5: The bishop retreats. Black tries to corner it in by doing a4.
moves.11. a4: White stops the move from happening.
moves.12. axb5 cxb5: Black and white exchange pawns on b5. Back can STILL corner the bishop.
moves.13. O-O: White castles. Black is far from castling.
moves.14. Nxb5: The knight takes the pawn on b5, preventing the bishop from being cornered.
moves.14... Kf7: The king moves toward his pieces.
moves.15. Ne5+ Ke8 16. Nc7+ Ke7: The knights come and check the king twice, and he is being cornered himself. The rook is about to be taken.
moves.18. Qe2 Rh6 19. Qb5: White and black take out their queens and rooks. What are they up to?
moves.19... Bxg2: The bishop takes a main guarding pawn on whites king.
moves.20. Qxb8: The queen takes a free knight in return.
moves.20... Qg5: Blacks queen is planning checkmate! Black can Checkmate in one!
moves.22. Qf7#: The White queen checkmates, just as white was about to be checkmated.
